impactedUsers.accessible-auth-minimum: Users with cognitive disabilities (dyslexia, memory impairments)
impactedUsers.accesskeys: Keyboard-only users and screen reader users (duplicate access keys cause unpredictable focus jumps)
impactedUsers.area-alt: Screen reader users navigating image maps
impactedUsers.aria-allowed-attr: Screen reader users (invalid attributes cause unpredictable AT behavior)
impactedUsers.aria-allowed-role: Screen reader users (mismatched roles cause incorrect element announcements)
impactedUsers.aria-command-name: Screen reader users and voice control users
impactedUsers.aria-conditional-attr: Screen reader users (conditional attributes in incorrect states confuse AT)
impactedUsers.aria-deprecated-role: Screen reader users (deprecated roles may be dropped by AT in future versions)
impactedUsers.aria-dialog-name: Screen reader users (unnamed dialogs are announced without context)
impactedUsers.aria-hidden-body: All users (entire page becomes invisible to assistive technology)
impactedUsers.aria-hidden-focus: Keyboard-only users and screen reader users
impactedUsers.aria-input-field-name: Screen reader users and voice control users
impactedUsers.aria-meter-name: Screen reader users (meters without names are announced as unlabeled gauges)
impactedUsers.aria-progressbar-name: Screen reader users (progress bars without names cannot be identified)
impactedUsers.aria-required-children: Screen reader users (missing required child roles break widget navigation)
impactedUsers.aria-required-parent: Screen reader users (orphaned child roles are not recognized by AT)
impactedUsers.aria-roledescription: Screen reader users (misapplied roledescription overrides meaningful role announcements)
impactedUsers.aria-roles: Screen reader users (invalid roles are ignored or misinterpreted by AT)
impactedUsers.aria-text: Screen reader users (elements with role='text' or aria-label on non-interactive elements may cause fragmented or missing announcements)
impactedUsers.aria-toggle-field-name: Screen reader users and voice control users
impactedUsers.aria-tooltip-name: Screen reader users and keyboard-only users
impactedUsers.aria-treeitem-name: Screen reader users navigating tree views
impactedUsers.aria-valid-attr: Screen reader users (invalid ARIA attributes are ignored by AT)
impactedUsers.audio-caption: Deaf users and users with hearing disabilities
impactedUsers.autocomplete-valid: Users with motor disabilities and cognitive disabilities
impactedUsers.avoid-inline-spacing: Users with low vision and users with reading disabilities who override text spacing
impactedUsers.blink: Users with vestibular disorders, photosensitive epilepsy, and cognitive disabilities
impactedUsers.button-name: Screen reader users and voice control users
impactedUsers.bypass: Keyboard-only users and screen reader users
impactedUsers.color-contrast: Users with low vision or color blindness
impactedUsers.consistent-help: Users with cognitive disabilities who rely on consistent page layouts
impactedUsers.css-orientation-lock: Users with motor disabilities who mount devices in a fixed orientation
impactedUsers.definition-list: Screen reader users (incorrect dl structure breaks term/definition relationships)
impactedUsers.dlitem: Screen reader users (dd/dt elements outside dl lose semantic meaning)
impactedUsers.document-title: Screen reader users and users with cognitive disabilities
impactedUsers.dragging-movements: Users with motor disabilities who cannot perform drag gestures
impactedUsers.duplicate-id-aria: Screen reader users (broken accessible name, description, or widget relationships)
impactedUsers.empty-heading: Screen reader users navigating by headings
impactedUsers.empty-table-header: Screen reader users (empty headers provide no context for associated data cells)
impactedUsers.focus-appearance: Keyboard-only users and users with low vision
impactedUsers.focus-order-semantics: Keyboard-only users and screen reader users
impactedUsers.frame-focusable-content: Keyboard-only users (focusable content trapped in inaccessible frames)
impactedUsers.frame-tested: All users (untested frames may contain undetected accessibility violations)
impactedUsers.frame-title-unique: Screen reader users navigating between multiple frames
impactedUsers.heading-order: Screen reader users navigating by headings
impactedUsers.hidden-content: Screen reader users (hidden content may still be announced or may hide important information)
impactedUsers.html-has-lang: Screen reader users (language detection for pronunciation)
impactedUsers.html-lang-valid: Screen reader users (language detection for pronunciation)
impactedUsers.html-xml-lang-mismatch: Screen reader users (conflicting language declarations cause pronunciation errors)
impactedUsers.identical-links-same-purpose: Screen reader users navigating the links list and voice control users
impactedUsers.image-alt: Blind users relying on screen readers
impactedUsers.image-redundant-alt: Screen reader users (redundant announcements increase cognitive load)
impactedUsers.input-button-name: Screen reader users and voice control users
impactedUsers.input-image-alt: Blind users relying on screen readers
impactedUsers.label: Screen reader users and voice control users
impactedUsers.label-content-name-mismatch: Voice control users (Dragon NaturallySpeaking, iOS Voice Control)
impactedUsers.label-title-only: Screen reader users and voice control users (title attribute is not universally exposed as the accessible name)
impactedUsers.landmark-banner-is-top-level: Screen reader users navigating by landmarks
impactedUsers.landmark-complementary-is-top-level: Screen reader users navigating by landmarks
impactedUsers.landmark-contentinfo-is-top-level: Screen reader users navigating by landmarks
impactedUsers.landmark-main-is-top-level: Screen reader users navigating by landmarks
impactedUsers.landmark-no-duplicate-banner: Screen reader users navigating by landmarks
impactedUsers.landmark-no-duplicate-contentinfo: Screen reader users navigating by landmarks
impactedUsers.landmark-no-duplicate-main: Screen reader users navigating by landmarks
impactedUsers.landmark-one-main: Screen reader users navigating by landmarks
impactedUsers.landmark-unique: Screen reader users navigating by landmarks
impactedUsers.link-in-text-block: Users with low vision or color blindness who cannot distinguish links by color alone
impactedUsers.link-name: Screen reader users and voice control users
impactedUsers.list: Screen reader users (list item count and navigation)
impactedUsers.listitem: Screen reader users (invalid list structure causes incorrect announcements)
impactedUsers.marquee: Users with vestibular disorders, cognitive disabilities, and screen reader users
impactedUsers.meta-refresh: Users with cognitive disabilities and screen reader users
impactedUsers.meta-viewport: Users who need to zoom (low vision, motor disabilities)
impactedUsers.meta-viewport-large: Users with low vision who need to zoom beyond the default maximum scale
impactedUsers.nested-interactive: Keyboard-only users and screen reader users
impactedUsers.no-autoplay-audio: Screen reader users (audio conflicts with AT speech), users with cognitive disabilities, users with vestibular disorders
impactedUsers.object-alt: Blind users relying on screen readers
impactedUsers.p-as-heading: Screen reader users navigating by headings
impactedUsers.page-has-heading-one: Screen reader users navigating by headings
impactedUsers.presentation-role-conflict: Screen reader users (conflicting roles cause AT to ignore or misrepresent elements)
impactedUsers.redundant-entry: Users with cognitive disabilities and motor disabilities
impactedUsers.region: Screen reader users navigating by landmarks
impactedUsers.role-img-alt: Blind users relying on screen readers
impactedUsers.scope-attr-valid: Screen reader users navigating data tables
impactedUsers.select-name: Screen reader users and voice control users
impactedUsers.server-side-image-map: Keyboard-only users and screen reader users
impactedUsers.skip-link: Keyboard-only users and screen reader users
impactedUsers.summary-name: Screen reader users and voice control users
impactedUsers.svg-img-alt: Blind users relying on screen readers
impactedUsers.table-duplicate-name: Screen reader users (duplicate announcement of table description creates cognitive load)
impactedUsers.table-fake-caption: Screen reader users (spanning cells used as captions are not associated with the table)
impactedUsers.target-size: Mobile/touch users and users with motor disabilities
impactedUsers.td-has-header: Screen reader users navigating data tables
impactedUsers.td-headers-attr: Screen reader users navigating complex tables
impactedUsers.valid-lang: Screen reader users (language detection for pronunciation)
impactedUsers.video-caption: Deaf users and users with hearing disabilities

expected.accessible-auth-minimum: Authentication processes must not require solving a cognitive function test without providing an accessible alternative method (WCAG 3.3.8).
expected.accesskeys: The accesskey attribute value must be unique across the page to prevent conflicting keyboard shortcuts.
expected.area-alt: Every <area> element in an image map must have an alt attribute that describes the link destination.
expected.aria-allowed-attr: ARIA attributes used on an element must be valid for that element's role. Invalid attributes must be removed.
expected.aria-allowed-role: The role attribute value must be appropriate for the element. Assigning a role that conflicts with the element's native semantics confuses assistive technology.
expected.aria-braille-equivalent: Elements with aria-braillelabel or aria-brailleroledescription must also have a non-braille accessible name or roledescription.
expected.aria-command-name: Elements with ARIA command roles (button, link, menuitem) must have a non-empty accessible name.
expected.aria-conditional-attr: ARIA attributes that are conditional on the element's state or role must only be used when those conditions are met.
expected.aria-deprecated-role: Elements must not use deprecated ARIA roles. Replace deprecated roles with their modern equivalents.
expected.aria-dialog-name: Elements with role="dialog" or role="alertdialog" must have a non-empty accessible name via aria-label or aria-labelledby.
expected.aria-hidden-body: The <body> element must not have aria-hidden="true", as this hides the entire page from assistive technology.
expected.aria-hidden-focus: Elements with aria-hidden="true" must not be focusable.
expected.aria-input-field-name: ARIA input roles (textbox, searchbox, spinbutton, slider, combobox) must have an accessible name.
expected.aria-meter-name: Elements with role="meter" must have a non-empty accessible name via aria-label or aria-labelledby.
expected.aria-progressbar-name: Elements with role="progressbar" must have a non-empty accessible name via aria-label or aria-labelledby.
expected.aria-prohibited-attr: ARIA attributes must only be used on roles that allow them per the WAI-ARIA specification.
expected.aria-required-attr: ARIA roles must include all required attributes defined in the WAI-ARIA spec.
expected.aria-required-children: ARIA parent roles must contain their required child roles (e.g., role="list" must contain role="listitem").
expected.aria-required-parent: ARIA child roles must be nested within their required parent roles (e.g., role="listitem" must be inside role="list").
expected.aria-roledescription: The aria-roledescription attribute must only be used on elements with a valid implicit or explicit ARIA role.
expected.aria-roles: All role attribute values must be valid ARIA roles from the WAI-ARIA specification.
expected.aria-text: Elements using role="text" or aria-label on non-interactive container elements should ensure AT reads the content as a single uninterrupted string without losing child semantics.
expected.aria-toggle-field-name: Toggle fields (checkbox, radio, role='switch') must have an accessible name so AT can announce what is being toggled.
expected.aria-tooltip-name: Elements with role="tooltip" must have a non-empty accessible name.
expected.aria-treeitem-name: Elements with role="treeitem" must have a non-empty accessible name.
expected.aria-valid-attr: All ARIA attributes must be valid and spelled correctly per the WAI-ARIA specification.
expected.aria-valid-attr-value: ARIA attributes must use only valid values defined in the WAI-ARIA spec.
expected.audio-caption: All <audio> elements with speech or meaningful audio must provide synchronized captions or a full transcript.
expected.autocomplete-valid: Inputs collecting personal data must have a valid autocomplete attribute per WCAG 1.3.5.
expected.avoid-inline-spacing: Inline styles must not use !important on text-spacing properties (letter-spacing, word-spacing, line-height) to allow user overrides (WCAG 1.4.12).
expected.blink: The <blink> element must not be used. Blinking content cannot be paused or stopped by the user (WCAG 2.2.2).
expected.button-name: Every <button> and [role="button"] must have a non-empty accessible name.
expected.bypass: Page must provide a mechanism to skip repetitive navigation (e.g., a skip link).
expected.color-contrast: Text contrast ratio must be at least 4.5:1 for normal text, 3:1 for large text.
expected.consistent-help: Help mechanisms must appear in the same relative order on every page where they are provided (WCAG 3.2.6).
expected.css-orientation-lock: Content must not be locked to a single display orientation (portrait or landscape) unless a specific orientation is essential (WCAG 1.3.4).
expected.definition-list: A <dl> element must only contain <dt> and <dd> groups, <div>, <script>, or <template> elements as direct children.
expected.dlitem: Every <dt> and <dd> element must be contained within a <dl> element.
expected.document-title: Page must have a descriptive, unique <title> element.
expected.dragging-movements: All drag-and-drop functionality must have an equivalent single-pointer alternative operable without dragging (WCAG 2.5.7).
expected.duplicate-id: All id attributes must be unique within the document.
expected.duplicate-id-aria: All IDs referenced by ARIA attributes must be unique within the document. Duplicate ARIA-referenced IDs cause AT to resolve to the first matching element, breaking all subsequent references.
expected.empty-heading: Every heading element must contain non-empty, meaningful text content.
expected.empty-table-header: Table header cells (<th>) must contain non-empty text content so screen readers can announce column or row context.
expected.focus-appearance: Focus indicators must be clearly visible, with a minimum area of the component perimeter × 2 CSS px and a 3:1 contrast ratio between focused and unfocused states (WCAG 2.4.11).
expected.focus-order-semantics: Elements in the focus order must have an appropriate interactive role. Non-interactive elements with tabindex="0" should use a suitable ARIA role.
expected.form-field-multiple-labels: Each form input must have exactly one accessible name source (label, aria-label, or aria-labelledby).
expected.frame-focusable-content: Frames with tabindex="-1" must not contain focusable content, as keyboard users cannot reach it.
expected.frame-tested: All <iframe> elements must be testable by the accessibility engine. Frames that fail to load or block testing may contain undetected violations.
expected.frame-title: Every <iframe> must have a descriptive title attribute.
expected.frame-title-unique: Each <iframe> on the page must have a unique title attribute to distinguish it from other frames.
expected.heading-order: Heading levels must not skip (h1 → h2 → h3, no gaps allowed).
expected.hidden-content: Content hidden from the page should be reviewed to ensure it is not unintentionally hidden from assistive technology users.
expected.html-has-lang: The <html> element must have a lang attribute.
expected.html-lang-valid: The lang attribute on <html> must be a valid BCP 47 language tag.
expected.html-xml-lang-mismatch: The lang and xml:lang attributes on the <html> element must specify the same base language.
expected.identical-links-same-purpose: Links with the same accessible name must have the same destination, or their distinct purpose must be distinguishable from context or accessible name.
expected.image-alt: Every must have an alt attribute. Decorative images use alt="".
expected.image-redundant-alt: Image alt text must not duplicate adjacent visible text. If adjacent text fully describes the image, use alt='' to mark it as decorative.
expected.input-button-name: Input elements with type 'button', 'submit', or 'reset' must have a non-empty accessible name via the value attribute or aria-label.
expected.input-image-alt: Every <input type="image"> must have an alt attribute describing the button's action.
expected.label: Every form input must have an associated <label>, aria-label, or aria-labelledby.
expected.label-content-name-mismatch: The accessible name of interactive elements must contain the visible label text (WCAG 2.5.3).
expected.label-title-only: Form inputs must not rely solely on the title attribute for their accessible name. Use a visible <label> or aria-label instead.
expected.landmark-banner-is-top-level: The banner landmark (header or role="banner") must be a top-level landmark, not nested inside another landmark.
expected.landmark-complementary-is-top-level: The complementary landmark (aside or role="complementary") must be a top-level landmark, not nested inside another landmark.
expected.landmark-contentinfo-is-top-level: The contentinfo landmark (footer or role="contentinfo") must be a top-level landmark, not nested inside another landmark.
expected.landmark-main-is-top-level: The main landmark must be a top-level landmark, not nested inside another landmark such as a nav or aside.
expected.landmark-no-duplicate-banner: A page must not have more than one banner landmark (<header> at top level or role='banner').
expected.landmark-no-duplicate-contentinfo: A page must not have more than one contentinfo landmark (<footer> at top level or role="contentinfo").
expected.landmark-no-duplicate-main: A page must not have more than one main landmark (<main> or role='main'). Multiple main landmarks break skip navigation.
expected.landmark-one-main: Page must contain exactly one <main> landmark element.
expected.landmark-unique: When multiple landmarks of the same type exist (e.g., multiple <nav> elements), each must have a unique accessible label.
expected.link-in-text-block: Links within blocks of text must be distinguishable from surrounding text by means other than color alone (e.g., underline or other visual indicator).
expected.link-name: Every <a href> must have descriptive, non-empty text content or an aria-label.
expected.list: <ul> and <ol> must only contain <li> elements as direct children. Screen readers use this structure to announce the list count and enable list navigation.
expected.listitem: <li> elements must be direct children of <ul>, <ol>, or <menu> elements.
expected.marquee: The <marquee> element must not be used. Use CSS animations with pause controls instead (WCAG 2.2.2).
expected.meta-refresh: Pages must not auto-refresh or auto-redirect with a non-zero delay (WCAG 2.2.1).
expected.meta-viewport: Viewport meta must not disable user scaling (user-scalable=no is forbidden).
expected.meta-viewport-large: The viewport meta tag should allow scaling to at least 500% to support users with low vision (WCAG 1.4.4).
expected.nested-interactive: Interactive elements (a, button, input, select, textarea) must not be nested inside other interactive elements.
expected.no-autoplay-audio: Audio that plays automatically must stop within 3 seconds, or a mechanism to pause/stop/mute it must be provided at the start of the page (WCAG 1.4.2).
expected.object-alt: Every <object> must have an accessible name via aria-label or aria-labelledby.
expected.p-as-heading: Text that visually functions as a section heading must be marked up with a heading element (<h1>–<h6>), not a styled paragraph.
expected.page-has-heading-one: Page must have exactly one <h1> element as the primary heading.
expected.presentation-role-conflict: Elements with role="presentation" or role="none" must not have global ARIA attributes or focusable states that conflict with the presentation role.
expected.redundant-entry: Information already submitted during the same session must be auto-populated or selectable without requiring re-entry (WCAG 3.3.7).
expected.region: All visible page content must be contained within a landmark element (main, nav, header, footer, aside).
expected.role-img-alt: Elements with role="img" must have a non-empty accessible name via aria-label or aria-labelledby.
expected.scope-attr-valid: The scope attribute on <th> elements must use a valid value (row, col, rowgroup, colgroup) and must not be used on <td> elements.
expected.scrollable-region-focusable: Any element with scrollable overflow must be reachable via keyboard (tabindex="0" or natively focusable).
expected.select-name: Every <select> must have an accessible name via <label>, aria-label, or aria-labelledby.
expected.server-side-image-map: Server-side image maps must not be used. Replace with client-side image maps or accessible alternatives operable via keyboard.
expected.skip-link: Skip navigation links must have a valid target that exists in the page and is focusable, allowing keyboard users to bypass repetitive content (WCAG 2.4.1).
expected.summary-name: Every <summary> element must have a non-empty accessible name describing the disclosure widget it controls.
expected.svg-img-alt: SVG elements used as images must have an accessible name (aria-label or aria-labelledby). Decorative SVGs must be hidden from AT with aria-hidden='true'.
expected.tabindex: tabindex values must be 0 or -1. Positive values disrupt natural focus order.
expected.table-duplicate-name: The <caption> and summary attribute of a table must not contain identical text — this causes screen readers to announce the same description twice.
expected.table-fake-caption: Tables must not use a spanning cell as a pseudo-caption. Use the <caption> element for table titles.
expected.target-size: All interactive targets must be at least 24×24 CSS pixels (WCAG 2.5.8). Spacing or a larger equivalent target is an acceptable alternative.
expected.td-has-header: Every data cell (<td>) in a data table must be associated with a header cell (<th>) via scope or headers attributes.
expected.td-headers-attr: When the headers attribute is used on <td>, every referenced ID must point to a valid <th> element in the same table.
expected.th-has-data-cells: Every <th> must have at least one associated data cell — a header with no data cells is meaningless structure.
expected.valid-lang: All lang attributes must use valid BCP 47 language codes.
expected.video-caption: All <video> elements with audio content must have synchronized captions via a <track kind='captions'> element.
